problem_text:
Let G be a finitely generated soluble minimax group and let H be a finitely generated residually finite group which has precisely the same finite images as G. Must H be a minimax group?
John S. Wilson
answer: Yes, it must (A. Mann, D. Segal, Proc. London Math. Soc. (3), 61 (1990), 529–545; see also A. V. Tushev, Math. Notes, 56, no. 5 (1994), 1190–1192).
